verses.roman:
namasye tvāṁ mahā-deva
lokānāṁ gurum īśvaram
puṁsām apūrṇa-kāmānāṁ
kāma-pūrāmarāṅghripam

synonyms: namasye—I bow down; tvām—to you; mahā-deva—O greatest of gods; lokānām—of the worlds; gurum—to the spiritual master; īśvaram—to the controller; puṁsām—for men; apūrṇa—unfulfilled; kāmānām—whose desires; kāma-pūra—fulfilling desires; amara-aṅghripam—(like) a tree of heaven.
translation: [Bāṇāsura said:] O Lord Mahādeva, I bow down to you, the spiritual master and controller of the worlds. You are like the heavenly tree that fulfills the desires of those whose desires are unfulfilled.
